Memory_Foreshadowing.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" foreshadows Mamzell Amira, a character from the serial killer questline in act 3/Baldur's Gate.
Memory_Foreshadowing.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Closed Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.

Memory_ButcherDoors.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts how a colony uses the flesh of its victims to expand, like a living thing.
Memory_ButcherDoors.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Butchered Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.

Memory_Vault.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader", found in the Vault.
Memory_Vault.how_to_trigger: Insert the corresponding Brain Jar (_COL_Vault_MemoryJar_193f87db-6a26-4f00-a289-63e247740176) into the Brain Reading Device receptacle in the lower Colony, in the Memory Library. Then, interact with the floating head next to the receptacle to start the dialog.

Memory_TutorialSlave.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts a kidnapped thrall who knows MF's are in their head.  This is one of the brain jars that can be found in the tutorial area of the game.
Memory_TutorialSlave.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Slave Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.- This jar is one of the two jars that can be found in the tutorial level (Nautiloid).

Memory_Raptured.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts an example memory of a citizen being taken. This memory belongs to a child who was abducted, and should be spoken as if relaying the memories / personality of a toddler.
Memory_Raptured.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Fresh Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.

Memory_TrueSoul.synopsis: A Brain Reader dialogue, delivered by a disembodied head channeling a brain which has been inserted into the reader device.This character is the first 'True Soul' - a mortal who was tadpoled and then brainwashed into believing they were the chosen of a new god.
Memory_TrueSoul.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "True Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.

Memory_None.synopsis: The default dialog that plays when interacting with the brain reading device/severed head in the lower Colony. Interacting with the severed head will yield no information, as it only serves to narrate memories from brain jars inserted into the device.
Memory_None.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head. Talk to it without inserting a brain jar into the receptacle next to it, and it will give this dialogue.

Memory_TutorialDark.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts victim singing a sad folk song. This is one of the brain jars that can be found in the tutorial area of the game.
Memory_TutorialDark.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Dark Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.- This jar is one of the two jars that can be found in the tutorial level (Nautiloid).

Memory_DeviceExplained.synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts an example memory, of Balthazar experimenting on a thrall in order to try out the brain reading device. The memory belongs to an enthralled subject.
Memory_DeviceExplained.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/SCL_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe MemLib_AllJars" to get all the brain jars and teleport to the Brain Reading Device.- In front of you will be a severed head and a receptacle to its left. Insert the appropriate brain jar into the receptacle by interacting with it - the jar is called "Willing Mind".- After inserting the jar, it will appear on top of the receptacle and you can talk to the severed head for the dialogue to start.

Memory_Foreshadowing_0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Foreshadowing_0.text: Won't be laughing. Won't be laughing when I'm a watchman.
Memory_Foreshadowing_0.context: NodeContext: Bitter but dazed mutterings - not aware of player's presence, or that they're just a brain in a jar

Memory_Foreshadowing_2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Foreshadowing_2.text: They won't be laughing much longer. Won't be any more of this 'No gnomes in the City Watch, Brevin'.
Memory_Foreshadowing_2.context: NodeContext: Bitter but dazed mutterings - not aware of player's presence, or that they're just a brain in a jar

Memory_Foreshadowing_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Foreshadowing_1.text: This Gortash fella's got an idea. Kind of a training camp. Don't know how it gets me into the watch, but he seems the smart sort...
Memory_Foreshadowing_1.context: NodeContext: Bitter but dazed mutterings - not aware of player's presence, or that they're just a brain in a jar

Memory_ButcherDoors_5.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_5.text: Ssssshhhh. This place listens. It knows.

Memory_ButcherDoors_3.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_3.text: If we're going to escape, we have to be smart.

Memory_ButcherDoors_6.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_6.text: Right - you get it. I've been watching. Learning.

Memory_ButcherDoors_8.speaker: Player
Memory_ButcherDoors_8.text: I think your escape plan might be coming a little late.

Memory_ButcherDoors_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_1.text: Late? No, mate - I was watching. Learning.

Memory_ButcherDoors_7.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_7.text: This place is alive. A big, thinking thing - and it needs our flesh to grow. I've seen them put corpses in the walls - and they just melt away.

Memory_ButcherDoors_10.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_10.text: So we've got to trick it, see? Make it think we're part of it. That's why the doors only open for...

Memory_ButcherDoors_4.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_ButcherDoors_4.text: Wait. How did you get in here? Away, SLAVE! They might have taken your mind, but they won't have MINE!

Memory_Vault_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_1.text: Come now. You're as much a prisoner of this place as I. Let us aid one another.

Memory_Vault_24.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_24.context: NodeContext: Completely vacant - we've wiped his mind

Memory_Vault_29.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_29.text: HmmMM... fine bones... sharp jaw... some variety of elf?
Memory_Vault_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Working jaw, flitting through expressions as if testing the face out

Memory_Vault_20.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_20.text: Pretty enough for a flesh-prison - if not the noble githzerai features I was born with.

Memory_Vault_15.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_15.text: *The monk-like githzerai, sibling-race to the warrior githyanki. Their contempt for one another is eclipsed only by their shared hatred of the illithids.*

Memory_Vault_59.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_59.text: I'd guess you're no willing guest of the ghaik either. Perhaps we might aid one another.

Memory_Vault_12.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_12.text: Why? This form fits you so much better, cousin.

Memory_Vault_13.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_13.text: Well, a githyanki skull would be too tight a fit, cousin. Your people shunned psionics, after all - while mine mastered them.

Memory_Vault_69.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_69.text: I never broke, but... I've spent all these centuries awake. Aware. So here is my offer:

Memory_Vault_42.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_42.text: Use your tadpole. Erase me - and I will pass my technique onto you.

Memory_Vault_36.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_36.text: *You feel the oncoming void tug at the back of your mind and the edge of your soul.*

Memory_Vault_60.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_60.text: *Your patron bids you caution before agreeing to this pact. The monk isn't telling you everything.*

Memory_Vault_34.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_34.text: *You catch the lie - the monk isn't telling everything.*

Memory_Vault_8.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_8.text: I'm not sure I can - I have no psionic power.

Memory_Vault_4.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_4.text: If you want my help, then tell me the truth.

Memory_Vault_22.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_22.text: ...All right. I... the ghaik did not find my monastery. I led them there.
Memory_Vault_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Veneer of sanity immediately shatters - agitated and pleading

Memory_Vault_54.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_54.text: They promised me immortality. And they gave it - I have been their rotting trophy for centuries.

Memory_Vault_33.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_33.text: *As her agitation swells, so does her latent psionic power. To your tadpole, that guilt and terror are almost... fragrant.*

Memory_Vault_35.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_35.text: *You realise the illithids locked her away not as a trophy, but as a fine vintage.*

Memory_Vault_41.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_41.text: Please - touch my mind, and purge it. The moment you do, my knowledge will be yours.

Memory_Vault_67.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_67.text: Reach out and consume her mind.

Memory_Vault_27.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_27.text: Reach out and purge her mind.

Memory_Vault_43.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_43.text: *The awareness that floods you is nothing like the tadpole. It is tentative, and tinged with the loneliness of aeons.*

Memory_Vault_38.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_38.text: *It fades beneath your touch, but you feel something left behind. A fragment.*

Memory_Vault_58.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_58.text: It is only knowledge yet, without comprehension. But when you use it, you will... see...

Memory_Vault_66.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The face falls mid-sentence, conciousness gone

Memory_Vault_19.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_19.text: You want me to kill you. What if I can free you instead?

Memory_Vault_7.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_7.text: My people dwell in Limbo - a realm of pure, chaotic thought. With my mind gone, perhaps my soul will return there.

Memory_Vault_2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_2.text: Or perhaps not. Death, freedom - they are one and the same.

Memory_Vault_26.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_26.text: Touch my mind, and purge it - at the very moment you do, I will make my knowledge yours.

Memory_Vault_57.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_57.text: When you say 'erase' your mind - do by any chance mean 'smash your brain to bits'?

Memory_Vault_55.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_55.text: ...I do not. The ghaik have been warping flesh for millennia - who knows what damage they can undo.

Memory_Vault_46.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_46.text: It is my mind they enslave. It is my mind that must die.

Memory_Vault_65.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_65.text: I'm not sure I can - I have no psionic power.

Memory_Vault_31.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_31.text: ...A terrible fate, to be born without a high-mind. It was the one gift the ghaik truly gave us.

Memory_Vault_28.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_28.text: Return with one who bears this gift, then. Please.

Memory_Vault_14.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_14.text: Reach out and erase her mind.

Memory_Vault_23.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_23.text: You called yourself 'githzerai'. Is that some kind of githyanki?

Memory_Vault_71.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_71.text: Oh, for a set of hands to slap your face. The yanki lost their way the moment Gith threw down the ghaik empire.

Memory_Vault_56.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_56.text: Only we zerai continue the war to end the ghaik forever. Only we fight them their own battlefield - the mind.

Memory_Vault_0.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_0.text: How did you end up in that vault? Githzerai are supposed to be ultimate warriors.

Memory_Vault_48.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_48.text: Warriors of the mind, cousin. A discipline unknown to your kind - and the very reason we were attacked.

Memory_Vault_9.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_9.text: Warriors of the mind. Oh, there's some physical prowess involved, but the battlefield on which we truly fight the ghaik is their own.

Memory_Vault_53.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_53.text: My order taught a psionic technique much-feared by the ghaik. They destroyed us for it, and kept me as a trophy.

Memory_Vault_62.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_62.text: You're remarkably sane for a pickled brain.

Memory_Vault_61.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_61.text: A githzerai's mind is not so easily cracked. Our discipline was the very reason we were attacked.

Memory_Vault_37.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault_37.text: I'm listening. What aid are you offering?

Memory_Vault_47.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_47.text: Only because I haven't told you how you will benefit.

Memory_Vault_51.speaker: Narrator
Memory_Vault_51.text: *The monk-like githzerai, sibling race to your own githyanki. The only beings your people hate more are the illithids themselves.*

Memory_Vault_68.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault_68.text: Erase me. Please. My knowledge will be yours.

Memory_TutorialSlave_2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialSlave_2.text: They're in my head - THEY'RE IN MY HEAD.

Memory_TutorialSlave_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialSlave_1.text: They're... in yours too. It won't be long now. Until we're changed.

Memory_TutorialSlave_0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialSlave_0.text: Am I dead? I don't want to die. But I don't want to live. Not like this.

Memory_Raptured_5.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_5.context: NodeContext: A little sulky - pushing you away as the toddler goes back to sleep

Memory_Raptured_13.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_13.text: Can I go back to bed, mummy?

Memory_Raptured_9.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_9.text: I live here. This is my house. Our house. Right, mummy?
Memory_Raptured_9.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player - their "mummy" - is playing a game with them

Memory_Raptured_4.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_4.text: We saw a big spiky snail that fell out of the sky!

Memory_Raptured_26.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_26.text: I'm just very sleepy, mummy... I wish you'd stop waking me up so much.

Memory_Raptured_19.speaker: Player
Memory_Raptured_19.text: Time to go back to sleep, then. Good night... you.

Memory_Raptured_23.speaker: Player
Memory_Raptured_23.text: I meanwhile am never going to sleep again.

Memory_Raptured_0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_0.text: You should! We can talk in the morning.

Memory_Raptured_8.speaker: Player
Memory_Raptured_8.text: You'll never wake again, little one.

Memory_Raptured_15.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_15.text: Why are you being so mean, mummy? Go away!

Memory_Raptured_1.speaker: Player
Memory_Raptured_1.text: I am very much not your mother.

Memory_Raptured_24.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_24.text: I don't know what that means...

Memory_Raptured_25.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_25.text: I had the dream again. The big spiky snail that came from the sky.
Memory_Raptured_25.context: NodeContext: Matter of factly relaying a dream

Memory_Raptured_16.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Raptured_16.text: I'm sleepy, mummy. You must stop waking me up.

Memory_Raptured_2.speaker: Player
Memory_Raptured_2.text: Uh, sure. Go right on back to sleep.

Memory_TrueSoul_9.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_9.context: NodeContext: A little agitated but still vague - trying to remember something

Memory_TrueSoul_16.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_16.text: Every day he comes. Every day for three days, to ask me how I feel.

Memory_TrueSoul_4.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_4.text: I want to tell, but... I am confused. Which... which day is it?

Memory_TrueSoul_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_1.text: The first, yes! Five days since he put that thing in my eye, but the first day he came to visit.
Memory_TrueSoul_1.context: NodeContext: A little clarity now we've specified for her

Memory_TrueSoul_19.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_19.text: He says I am the last. That the other subjects have all changed.

Memory_TrueSoul_10.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_10.text: Eye hurts. Head hurts. But he says I am past the worst of it - that I won't change like the others.
Memory_TrueSoul_10.context: NodeContext: Remembering pain, but it's vague - beyond feeling now

Memory_TrueSoul_3.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_3.text: He's given me a place of honour, so he can repeat his miracle. And a name:
Memory_TrueSoul_3.context: NodeContext: Vague, but pleased and honoured

Memory_TrueSoul_2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_2.text: She whispers in my mind. She sings.
Memory_TrueSoul_2.context: NodeContext: Whispering, borderline rapture - having a religious experience

Memory_TrueSoul_20.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_20.context: NodeContext: Whispering, borderline rapture - having a religious experience

Memory_TrueSoul_8.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_8.text: Separate cells - I never saw them. But when they changed...

Memory_TrueSoul_18.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_18.text: MY HEAD! I CAN FEEL THEM IN MY HEAD!
Memory_TrueSoul_18.context: NodeContext: sudden lurch from quiet line before to screamed terror here - immediately resets to vague default at end of line

Memory_TrueSoul_6.speaker: Player
Memory_TrueSoul_6.text: Who is this 'he' you're talking about?

Memory_TrueSoul_15.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_15.text: We are his pets. His plan.

Memory_TrueSoul_5.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TrueSoul_5.context: NodeContext: Said with fear and reverance

Memory_None_0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_None_0.text:
... empty vessel ... nothing more...
... lending voice... to elder lore...
Memory_None_0.context: NodeContext: A severed head in which brains can be inserted in order to play out memories. This is its drooling default state, when no brain is inserted.

Memory_TutorialDark_2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark_2.context: NodeContext: Eerily humming opening bars of song that was just song

Memory_TutorialDark_4.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark_4.text:
Oh, my darling Carolina
how I'd love to wine and dine ya
but you chose my foolish brother over me...
Memory_TutorialDark_4.context: NodeContext: singing (Note: the writer, Sarah Baylus, says in the Jira thread that she will pass the melody for the voice talent to follow)

Memory_TutorialDark_3.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark_3.text:
And when you two are wed
Well, my heart will be but dead
For my sister you will sadly, surely be.

Memory_TutorialDark_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark_1.text:
But my brother, he's a loser
And I take you for a chooser
So perhaps one day you'll leave him high and dry.

Memory_TutorialDark_0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark_0.text:
And if you choose another
What's more loving than a brother
Yes, a stand-up, homely, gentle sort of guy.

Memory_DeviceExplained_5.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_5.text: The owlbear bore Auril's icy ire.
Memory_DeviceExplained_5.context: NodeContext: A tongue twister as vocal warm-up. 'Auril' (OW-ril) is an angry goddess of winter

Memory_DeviceExplained_15.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_15.text: Pardon! Wouldn't do to phlegm all over Lord Gortash during my first performance, would it?
Memory_DeviceExplained_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coughing, clearing throatNodeContext: Clears throat before pardon

Memory_DeviceExplained_2.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_2.text: Acoustics are a little off in here. Which is... where, exactly?

Memory_DeviceExplained_4.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_4.text: An illithid colony. But don't worry - just your brain is here.

Memory_DeviceExplained_7.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_7.text: Right. A jester, are you? You must be vying for the lord's patronage too.

Memory_DeviceExplained_17.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_17.text: Are you some kind of performer?

Memory_DeviceExplained_18.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_18.text: Just a serving girl with notions - 'til I met Lord Gortash.

Memory_DeviceExplained_3.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_3.text: Never mind that. Tell me about this Lord Gortash.

Memory_DeviceExplained_6.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_6.text: He heard me singing in Beggar's Rest. Said he needed someone to 'give voice to lost knowledge'.

Memory_DeviceExplained_19.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_19.text: A little over my head, being honest, but the lord has gold. I trust he knows his business. Now - I'd best warm up.

Memory_DeviceExplained_16.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_16.text: What did you plan on singing? It ought to be remembered.

Memory_DeviceExplained_21.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_21.text: Oddly sentimental. Or mayhaps you're just looking for an edge on the competition, eh?

Memory_DeviceExplained_0.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_0.text: No fooling me. Patience - you'll hear it when Lord Gortash does.

Memory_DeviceExplained_11.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_11.text: No need. I think you got the part.

Memory_DeviceExplained_9.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_9.text: Truly? Hah! And my ma said the singing would come to naught. Thank you. Thank you.

Memory_DeviceExplained_14.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_14.text: Go ahead. I'm sure you'll be performing soon.

Memory_DeviceExplained_20.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_20.text: I have just the thing prepared - my ma used to sing it when I'd come crying about monsters. Wish me luck!

Memory_DeviceExplained_13.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained_13.text: Snap out of it - and look around you.

Memory_DeviceExplained_8.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pause while the fixed head takes in the illithid hall.

Memory_DeviceExplained_1.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_1.text: Could do with a bit of natural light, all right. But you know these nobles - odd as fae folk.

Memory_DeviceExplained_12.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained_12.text: Now, I need to prepare. Wish me luck!
